gpioPinOpen.title: GPIO pin for open signal
gpioPinOpen.description: The GPIO pin the plugin should use to open the garage door.

gpioPinClose.title: GPIO pin for close signal
gpioPinClose.description: The GPIO pin the plugin should use to close the garage door. This can be the same as the pin for opening.

emitTime.title: Emit time
emitTime.description: How many milliseconds should the GPIO output be HIGH?

executionTime.title: Execution time
executionTime.description: How many seconds does the garage door to execute an open or close command?

allowCommandOverride.title: Allow command override
allowCommandOverride.description: Define if sending a new command while the garage door is still executing the previous command should be allowed.

reverseOutput.title: Negate output
reverseOutput.description: If enabled, a open signal will be sent as HIGH-LOW-HIGH, instead of the default behaviour LOW-HIGH-LOW.

webhookEnabled.title: Enable webhook
webhookEnabled.description: If enabled, the plugin will expose a webhook to open or close the garage door.

webhookPort.title: Webhook port
webhookPort.description: The port the webhook should listen on.

webhookPath.title: Webhook path
webhookPath.description: The path the webhook should listen on.

webhookJsonPath.title: Webhook JSON path
webhookJsonPath.description: The JSON path to the value of the garage door state. A truthy value indicates an open garage door.

webhookJsonValueReverse.title: Reverse JSON value
webhookJsonValueReverse.description: If enabled, the plugin will reverse the value of the JSON path. E.g. a truthy value will become falsy.
